intro: Elodea longivaginata, commonly known as the long鞘 waterweed, is a species of aquatic plant belonging to the Hydrocharitaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, whorled leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in length. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually submerged or floating, followed by small, dark brown fruits. It thrives in freshwater environments such as ponds, lakes, and slow-moving streams. Elodea longivaginata plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen through photosynthesis.
